concept.title: Git History view
concept.shortdesc: The Git History view displays a complete log of the changes commited to the current branch with detailed information about each commit. Apart from displaying the history of an entire branch, you can also use this view to see the history of a file listed in the staging area.

conbody.p: You can open the Git History view by using the Show current branch history toolbar action or by selecting the Show history and Show blame context menu actions in on a file in the staging area.
The view is divided into three main panels to provide a clear overview of the history of a branch or a file. By default, the view appears docked to the bottom of the window.

section.title: Commit log
section.p: The commit log panel lists all the commits added to the current branch with additional information about the exact date and time when the changes were commited, the author of the commit, and short hash. By default, the log is sorted by date in descending order.
If there are uncommited changes, they appear as a separate entry at the top of the list.

section.title: Commit details
section.p: The commit details panel displays detailed information about the commit that is currently selected in the log.

You can use this panel to preview a commit's long hash, its parent commit short hash, the change author's full name and email address, the exact date and time when the commit was added, and the full text of the commit message.
